metadata.title: CVE-2017-5753 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
Systems with microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and branchprediction may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attackerwith local user access via a side-channel analysis.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5753` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-32-generic - 4.13.0-32.35
linux-image-4.13.0-32-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-32.35
linux-image-4.13.0-32-lowlatency - 4.13.0-32.35
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-32-generic - 4.13.0-32.35
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1006-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1006.7
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-oem - 4.15.0-1002.3
No subscription required

firefox - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libcuda1-375 - 384.111-0ubuntu1
libcuda1-384 - 384.111-0ubuntu1
nvidia-375 - 384.111-0ubuntu1
nvidia-384 - 384.111-0ubuntu1
nvidia-libopencl1-375 - 384.111-0ubuntu1
nvidia-libopencl1-384 - 384.111-0ubuntu1
nvidia-opencl-icd-375 - 384.111-0ubuntu1
nvidia-opencl-icd-384 - 384.111-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.18.6-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.18.6-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.18.6-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.18.6-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.18.6-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.18.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-32.35').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1006.7').
linux-aws package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
linux-azure package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
linux-gcp package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
linux-oem package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.3').
firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-384 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '384.111-0ubuntu1').
webkit2gtk package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.18.6-1').
